gamenews.headline: Manage Containers
gamenews.message:
How to quickly manage and arrange the contents of your backpacks:
 

Manage Containers

Premium players can use the Manage Containers dialog to assign categories to containers.
Items obtained from looting, NPCs, the depot and the stash are then automatically placed in their assigned containers.

You can open the dialog via the context menu of a container, the Cyclopedia, or a configurable hotkey.

Under "Loot", you manage the containers for items looted from creatures. 
Under "Obtain", you manage containers for items obtained through other means.

To assign a categoy, press the crosshairs button next to it and click on the container of your choice. Done!

From now on, items of this category will be automatically put into that container.

To remove a category from a container, simply press the X button next to the category in the Manage Containers dialog.

You can assign multiple categories to the same container.

If you hover over the small bag icon in the lower right corner of a container that has at least one category assigned to it, these categories will be displayed.

Items of categories you have not assigned to a specific container, will be placed into the Unassigned container for looted and obtained items.

Per default, this is your main container, the one you have equipped in the body slot. You can also select different containers via the Manage Containers dialog.

Quick Sort Container

You can sort the contents of your backpacks according to various criteria by opening the respective menu.

Sorting options include sorting ascending/descending by name, weight, expiry and stack size.

Additionally, you can sort nested containers, prioritise backpacks to be sorted first within the inventory, and you can switch on the manual sort mode to be able to drag and drop items to any location within the backpack.

gamenews.headline: The Soulpit
gamenews.message:
Conquer the very soul of a creature in the Soulpit to unlock its Animus Mastery, a permanent experience boost. 

Whenever you kill a fiendish creature, you have a chance to obtain its soul core. Rarely, it may also drop the soul core of an uncommon, rare, or very rare creature within the same Bestiary class.

A soul core is your key to a challenging fight against stronger versions of this creature in the Soulpit.

You can transform a soul core into another one that might better suit your preferences.
There are three options:

1) Soul Prism + Soul Core = Transforms a soul core into one of the next higher Bestiary difficulty.

  + =

Soul prisms can be looted from fiendish creatures.

2) Exalted Core + Soul Core = Transforms a soul core into one of the next lower Bestiary difficulty.

  + =

Exalted cores can be obtained by converting slivers at the Exaltatation Forge.

3 )Soul Core + Soul Core = Combines two soul cores into a random soul core of any Bestiary difficulty.

  + =

The Soulpit is located in the north-eastern part of Hrodmir.

Enter the ice skull and use the obelisk inside with a soul core to get teleported into the pit. 
Only one soul core is needed to teleport a group of up to 5 players.

Prepare to fight four increasingly difficult waves of descendants of the soul core creature.
In the final wave, a particularly strong specimen challenges you with one of three special abilities:

Enrage

The creature's damage and resilience increases as its vitality wanes

Oppressor

Can leave you hexed, simultaneously feared and rooted, or powerless

Overpower

Allows your enemy to torture you with sudden spikes in damage.

You have 10 minutes to complete the entire challenge. Be careful! The regular death penalty applies in the Soulpit.

Soulpit creatures do not drop loot or dust, they are not tameable or skinnable, and they do not count towards kill counters or kill statistics.

Soulpit creatures in the first three waves do not yield XP.
Defeating the final wave and thereby completing the challenge will grant you 2800% more XP than killing the usual creature.

It also unlocks the creature's animus mastery for all participants present at the time of success: You now benefit of a permanent XP bonus of 2% for that creature.

 

You can increase this bonus up to 4%:
It will increase by 0.1% for every 10 animus masteries you unlock.
The maximum bonus of 4% is reached when you have mastered 200 different creatures.

You can also earn a title, an achievement and a special keepsake for unlocking animus mastery for numerous creatures.

gamenews.headline: Wheel of Destiny: Fragment Workshop
gamenews.message:
The Fragment Workshop allows you to upgrade mods to harness the full power of your gems.

You can access the Fragment Workshop by opening the Wheel of Destiny and clicking on the respective tab.

There, you can enhance your gem mods from Grade I to Grade IV to increase their power.

 

These upgrades require gold and fragments. Fragments are remnants of shattered gems.

 

Gems can be looted from Archfoe bosses, influenced and fiendish creatures.

To obtain fragments, you can either crush unrevealed gems with a crusher or amber crusher, or you can dismantle revealed gems in the Gem Atelier.

Fragments can also be purchased from jewelry shop NPCs, though this convenient option is priced accordingly.

 

 

 

Depending on the quality of the gem and whether it is revealed or unrevealed, you will receive a certain number of fragments.

  Lesser Gem Regular Gem Greater Gem
Unrevealed Gem 1-4 lesser fragments 2-8 lesser fragments 1-4 greater fragments
Revealed Gem 1-5 lesser fragments 2-10 lesser fragments 1-5 greater fragments

How to enhance mods in the Fragment Workshop?

If you click on a mod, you can check its unlocked and unlockable grades and their effects in the "Enhance Mod Grade" section.
It also shows how much gold and how many fragments you need to invest to unlock the next grade for this mod.
For a basic mod, you need lesser fragments; for a supreme mod, you need greater fragments.

 

Raising mods to their highest grade also earns you permanent promotion points: 
For every Grade IV mod, you will receive an additional Promotion Point for your Wheel of Destiny.

If you enhance a mod, its grade will be raised on all gems the mod appears on.
However, the effectiveness of the enhanced mod on a gem is limited
by the grade of the mods that come before it on the gem.
If they have a lower grade, the mod in question is also limited to that lower grade.

 

A special icon and tooltip in the Gem Atelier inform you if the grade of an enhanced mod is limited by the grade of a preceeding mod.

gamenews.headline: Basics
gamenews.message:
Use arrow keys or WASD to move around and to walk on stairs.

 

To use WASD, make sure Chat mode is off. 

The Tibia client allows you to adjust many game settings.
When you first open the Options menu, you will see only the basic ones.
To view all available settings, click "Show Advanced Options" at the bottom.

 

Do you prefer a mysterious atmosphere or a clear view?
You can find the slider to adjust "Ambient Light" in the Options menu under Graphics  > Effects.

 

Lower the slider to enjoy the subtle play of light and darkness. 
Set it high for a brighter environment.

 

The light around you also depends on the time of day and your location.
If you uncheck the box "Show Light Effects", you will not see any light effects at all.

 

You can find various light sources and place them in your Extra Slot to illuminate dark places. 
For example, if you have a torch equipped, click on it to light it.

gamenews.headline: Combat and Hunting
gamenews.message:
Click on a monster in the game window or in the battle list to attack it.
Use autoattack and attack spells to deal damage.

 

Press a hotkey or an action button to cast your spells.
The spells you can use depend on your vocation:
 

Maintain your health with healing spells and potions.

 

Defeat monsters to gain experience points.
When you level up, your health and mana are restored.

 

Search corpses for loot such as gold, food or equipment.

 

Press Alt+left-click or Alt+Q to loot everything from nearby corpses with a single click.

 

Your capacity and backpack slots limit how much your character can carry.

 

Inventory

Your inventory shows your characters' equipment.
It is split up into individual slots, representing the locations where items can be equipped.

1) Head Slot: for headgear
2) Torso Slot: for armor
3) Legs Slot: for leg gear
4) Feet Slot: for footwear
5) Amulet Slot: for a necklace or an amulet
6) Weapon Slot: for a weapon, e.g. sword, a bow, a rod or a wand
7) Ring Slot: for a ring
8) Container Slot: for a container such as a backpack
9) Shield Slot: for a shield, a spellbook or a quiver 
10) Extra Slot: for useful items such as a light source

To equip an item simply move it into the slot it is intended for.

 

Some equipment pieces require a certain vocation or minimum level.

 

Food is important

The field below your inventory shows if your character is affected by a special condition.
If you see this icon there, it means that your character is hungry.

 

Characters that are hungry do not regenerate any mana or health.
Look for something edible like a piece of meat and click on it to consume it. 

 

There is plenty of food in Tibia. You can loot it, buy it in shops, or harvest it.
You can even use certain ingredients to bake or cook.

 

What every adventurer needs

Always carry a rope in your backpack to be able to pull yourself up from holes.

Look for rope spots, little round shadows on the floor which indicate a hole above it.
Left-click on your rope, then left-click on the shadow to pull yourself up.

 

With a shovel, you can create holes in loose stone piles to go down one level.

Left-click on your shovel, then left-click on the stone pile to go down by opening a hole.

gamenews.headline: NPC Interaction
gamenews.message:
The permanent inhabitants of Tibia are usually referred to as NPCs, "non-player characters".
You can find NPCs almost everywhere from cities to remote areas. 
NPCs you can talk to are marked by a small speech bubble.

 

They may trade with you, send you on quests or provide you with valuable information.

To start a conversation simply greet them with "hi" or "hello" in the local chat.
The NPC channel will then open up automatically and the conversation will continue there.

 

Talking to NPCs is done by using key words.
Important key words are often marked with a light blue colour.
Left-click on a highlighted word or type it to find out what the NPC has to say about this.

 

You can also use your imagination to find more key words.
Typical key words include "name", "mission" or "job". 

 

How to trade

Look for NPC shopkeepers and merchants in cities to sell and buy items.
Greet them with "hi" and ask for a "trade". The trade window will then open up in the sidebar.

 

By pressing either Sell or Buy, you can quickly see which items you can trade with them.
Keep in mind that different NPCs may offer different items.

 

Click on the item of your choice (1) and use the slider to select how many of this item you would like to sell or buy (2).

The amount of the selected item, the total price, and the money your character owns are shown below the slider.

To finalise the trade, click "Ok" (3).

If you do not carry enough gold with you, the money will be taken from your Tibian bank account if you have enough stored there.

 

 

How to manage your finances

To manage your Tibian bank account, look for a bank.
They are often located near a city's depot.

To add gold to your Bank Account, tell the banker NPC "deposit" and the amount.
You can also say "deposit all" to add all the gold you are carrying with you.

 

To take gold out, say "withdraw" and the desired amount.

 

Ask for your "balance" to see how much gold you have.

gamenews.headline: Life and Death
gamenews.message:
Your character's hit points decrease when being attacked or harmed.
If your hit points drop to zero, your character will die and respawn in the temple of your hometown.

 

In the challenging world of Tibia, dying is not without penalties.
Based on your level, you lose experience and skills.
After reaching level 8, you may also lose items upon death.

 

For promoted characters, the experience and skills loss is lowered by 30%. 
Premium players can purchase a promotion at level 20 from royal figures like King Tibianus in Thais.
 

Blessings

Blessings reduce your character's experience and skill loss upon death. 
They also lower the chance of losing items.

Blessings can be purchased from certain NPCs ingame or via the Store.

 

A character with at least 5 blessings will not lose any items upon death.

The little ankh on the top left side of your inventory, tells you more about your blessings status:

 

Grey ankh: your character is not protected by any blessing.

Green ankh: your character is protected by all available regular blessings and the PvP blessing "Twist of Fate" provided it is available on the character's game world.

Yellow ankh: your character is protected by at least one blessing.

Click on the little ankh to open the Blessings dialog.

Here, you can check by which blessings your character is protected (1) and what factors influence the penalty for your next death (2).

Also, you can go right to the Store to purchase missing blessings by clicking on the Store button below the blessing in question.

Adventurer's Blessing

On Open PvP game worlds, characters up to level 20 are protected by the Adventurer's Blessing. 
Their inventory will be displayed with golden frames. 

 

If your character dies in a PvP fight being protected by this blessing,
your will not lose any items, experience and skill points.

But beware!
As soon as your character attacks another character first
or reaches level 21 for the first time, the blessing will be lost for good.
Then your inventory will then be displayed normally in grey.

gamenews.headline: Temple and Adventurers' Guild
gamenews.message:
Temples are safe places in each major city.

Inside, you can find a portal of citizenship.

Enter the teleporter to make a city your hometown.
You will now revive in this temple if you die.

Each temple has a priest who can heal you if your health is under 50.
They can also cure you from poison, burning, and other bad status effects.

 

 

Adventurers' Guild

When you left Dawnport, you received an adventurer's stone. 
You can also ask a temple priest for a new one. 
If you use this stone in a temple, you will be teleported right to the Adventurers' Guild.

 

There, you can find useful information and various NPCs who provide useful services.
For example, there is a banker and a shopkeeper selling basic items such as a rope and a shovel.

 

To return to the city you came from, use one of the two teleporters in the room you arrived in.
NPC Charos can change the destination of the teleporters to a city of your choice.

 

You can use this service 6 times in total.

gamenews.headline: Promotion
gamenews.message:
At level 20, your character can buy a promotion if your account has Premium status.
This is an elite rank for your vocation.

Depending on your vocation, you are promoted to 
elite knight, royal paladin, elder druid, or master sorcerer.

 

Besides receiving this title, a promoted character enjoys the following benefits:

  • experience and skill loss upon death is reduced by 30%
  • faster regeneration of hit points and mana
  • an extra spell unique to the vocation 
  • double the soul points with quicker soul point regeneration

Promotions can be bought for 20,000 gold pieces at royal figures in Tibia:

King Tibianus III of Thais
Queen Eloise of Carlin
Emperor Kruzak of Kazordoon
Grand Vizier Ishebad of Ankrahmun
Emperor Rehal of Beregar
Rotem Valos of the Adventurers' Guild

Talk to any of these NPCs and ask them to promote you.
If you meet the following conditions, you will be instantly promoted:

  • Your account has Premium status.
  • Your character is level 20 or higher.
  • You have the required amount of 20,000 gold.

 

Promotions are exclusive to Premium players.
If your Premium status expires, promoted characters lose their elite rank and benefits. 
However, these are restored without additional fees once you upgrade to Premium again.

gamenews.headline: Influenced and Fiendish Creatures
gamenews.message:
Influenced and fiendish creatures are more dangerous but offer exclusive loot.
 

Influenced and fiendish creatures have a low chance to spawn in place of a regular monster.
They are stronger versions of regular monsters, empowered by Sinister Embrace.

Influenced Creatures

 
The number below an influenced creature's name shows its Sinister Embrace stacks.
The higher the number, the stronger they are and the higher the potential to yield more dust.

Dust is a non-tradable resource required for using the Exaltation Forge in Tibia.
You can only get dust by killing influenced creatures.

Fiendish Creatures

Fiendish monsters are much rarer than influenced monsters.
You can use the spell Find Fiend to locate them.

 

Beware though! They are much stronger than influenced monsters.
Their power equals that of an influenced creature with 15 stacks,
indicated by the exclamation mark below their name.

Fiendish yield more dust, and you can also loot a tradable resource called slivers.

Whenever you kill a fiendish creature, you also have a chance to obtain a soul core.

 

You can use it in the Soulpit to fight increasingly difficult waves of the soul core creature. 
If you are successful, you unlock Animus Mastery for this creature, a permanent experience boost.

Gems

Influenced and fiendish creatures can drop gems for each vocation:

Guardian gems for knights, marksman gems for paladins,
sage gems for sorcerers and mystic gems for druids.

 

Gems come in three sizes: lesser, regular and greater.
You can either trade these gems with other players,
or reveal those for your vocation in the Gem Atelier.
There, you can place them in your Wheel of Destiny to amplify your character's power.
